asapy.preprocessing

Module Contents

Classes

Preprocessing

class asapy.preprocessing.Preprocessing
static aliases(x)

Preprocessing the simulation aliases. Adjusts the index of the dataframe by creating a new column ‘experiment’ that receives the current indices of the DataFrame.

Parameters:

x (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

Returns:

DataFrame with modified index.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static team_metrics(df)

Preprocesses the monitor report data with an additional filter for monitor_type.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • monitor_type (str) – The specific monitor type to filter by. For example, ‘AsaTeamMetrics@AsaModels’ or ‘AsaAirThreatMetric@AsaModels’.

Returns:

The preprocessed dataframe.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static air_threat_metric(df)

Preprocesses the monitor report data with an additional filter for monitor_type.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

Returns:

The preprocessed dataframe.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static weapon_detonation(df)

Function for pre-processing weapon detonation data.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – The dataframe to preprocess.

Returns:

The preprocessed dataframe.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static convert_categorical_to_dummies(df, column_name, prefix=None)

Convert a categorical column into dummy/indicator columns, and add these new columns into the DataFrame at the same position of the original one.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to process.

  • column_name (str) – The name of the categorical column to convert.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to apply to the dummy column names.

Returns:

The DataFrame with the original column replaced by dummy columns.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
